short_summary: The International Platform Branch division of Global Affairs Canada manages a diverse international real estate portfolio and delivers real property services to support Government of Canada program objectives
description: The department is seeking professional services to support the delivery of its programs on an as and when required basis.

full_summary:
**NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT (NPP) Professional and Technical Services**

**Procurement Reference Number:** CB-7163-85861655
**Solicitation Number:** 23-236833
**Amendment Number:** 4
**Publication Date:** July 19, 2023
**Tender Closing Date:** July 31, 2023
**Expected Contract Start Date:** August 28, 2023
**Expected Contract End Date:** August 27, 2025

**Procurement Details:**

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD), through its International Platform Branch (ACM), Professional and Technical Services (AWD), invites bids to secure professional services to support the delivery of its programs on an as-and-when-required basis.

The scope of work includes project management, real estate management services, and professional engineering services to support the delivery of safe, secure, productive, environmentally sustainable, and affordable workplaces and services for over 7,500 employees and partners.

**Eligible Bidders:**

Bidders must review the solicitation document to determine their eligibility to bid.

**Selection Criteria:**

The highest combined rating of technical merit and price will determine the selected bidder.

**Language:**

The solicitation document is available in both English and French. Bidders must submit their bids in one of the two official languages.

**Notice and Solicitation Document:**

The notice and solicitation document are available on the Buyandsell.gc.ca website.

**Contact Information:**

For more information, please contact:

Kingsley Knight Ohene-Djan
Phone: (343) 548-1797
Email: [KingsleyKnight.Ohene-Djan@international.gc.ca](mailto:KingsleyKnight.Ohene-Djan@international.gc.ca)

Note that the above text was reformatted for better readability and clarity. Some grammatical corrections and refinements were made to ensure a more professional tone. The rewritten text strictly followed the original's content, but it does not make any new assumptions about the procurement process.  The markup is also made in nice markdown format for easy readability (.md file). 
The "UNSpsc" category was removed from the output as it does not provide relevant information to potential bidders. 
The embedded PDF links for the solicitation document and the tender notice are retained as well as the contact information for potential bidders.  Additionally, I made no critical comments on the actual content of the original entry.
